dialogues.text: I

dialogues.text: T

dialogues.text: Three weeks, she'll be good as new. It's a remarkable crew. The best T hat...

dialogues.text: He stops.   Realizing where he was going.   She never loo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the best that money can buy. I just can't believe I've done this o us. All the money wasted that's never coming back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You cut the engines. It would have cost a bundle more to replace a burned-up plane. Not to mention pilot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I overreacted. The plane was too heavy, I should have used the rudder pedal instead of the throttle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears stand in her eyes. She is so ashamed and remorseful He lets it stay silent as they walk. Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: t's only money, we'll figure it out. We always do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll make it back and more, I promise. The book sales, the lectures, this flight will keep us going another three years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe.   Or...

dialogues.text: No, it will. Our prices, our sales, are going to double.

dialogues.text: A

dialogues.text: AMELIA(cont'd) This showed them how dangerous it all is, they were taking it for granted...

dialogues.text: She looks over.    Not sure if...

dialogues.text: You mean after.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or.     Even now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A strong smile.    He nods.     We could.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So my exit would be a stupid crash. nd withdrawing from a world- publicized attempt to finally do something no man had done before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeh. That. And it would be fine ith me.

dialogues.text: Her eyes overwhelmed A his offer. by                  Her voice soft with...

dialogues.text: But that's because you're an idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucky for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A held beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what if it's not something I have to show the world?

dialogues.text: Hmmn?

dialogues.text: What if it's something I have to show me.

dialogues.text: He has no answer for that.       Takes her hand.   They h the house.

dialogues.text: T

dialogues.text: The whirr and clang of tools. Amelia and George confer wi one foreman, as George sees something. He touches her arm points in our direction. REVERSE ANGLE as she sees... ...Gene has entered the hangar.    Stands by the folding we've seen before.

dialogues.text: Have fun.

dialogues.text: Who let you off the hook on this?

dialogues.text: Thanks for letting me come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Gene's smile can't mask the concern in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have a choice. I have to reverse my route and fly east. If go west now, I'm risking hurricanes in the Caribbean and monsoons in Africa...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you're flying Howland last, when you're exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She knows this.   In the silence...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gene, this way our first leg is Oakland to Miami. It's a shakedown o make sure the plane is right. That's crucial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gene nods, slowly.    His eyes still locked on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I'm obsessing on Howland because it was my bright idea, and I'd feel responsible if...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if I do pop off, I'll try to make it somewhere that's not your fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd appreciate that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Draws a breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You miss that island. You'll be out of fuel, with 2000 miles to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'll have Fred so I won't miss. In fact, I'm taking Fred along for this whole trip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surprisingly, he doesn't seem to like this.   She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Giving up my little arrogance about solo. Safety first, yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he's still unhappy.   She waits for him to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and Fred alone for a month...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're worried about his drinking, I'll deal with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Straight look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can handle Fred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now we get a sense of exactly what does worry him. glances to George...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you feel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tip-top. Every little girl needs a man around. Even strong girls like ours, hmmn?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very direct gaze.   Words neither said nor needed.

dialogues.speaker: T
dialogues.text: A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can handle us. She can handle Fred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A full beat.   The look holds between the men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And thanks for being here. You've always had Amelia's best interests t heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: he look still unbroken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, for that. I'm grateful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amelia and George crossing the tarmac from the Electra, waving to the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The legendary Amelia Earhart lands in Miami, completing the first and easiest leg of her around-the-world equatorial flight. A feat no man has ever attempted. That's hubby George with her, he gets off here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind them, coat slung casually across his shoulder, is Fred. Waving like he belongs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That handsome guy behind them isn't a movie star. Nope, it's navigator Fred Noonan, who will be Amelia's sole companion on the exotic odyssey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on the rugged smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, where does a guy go to apply for a job like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 89 The pastel sky has darkened along the row of legendary hotels. At first, we can barely find them at the water's edge. CLOSE to see her sitting where the surf can't quite reach her toes. He's lying back, hands cradling his head. Watching the stars come out. Nothing said. Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T O

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be flying sky no one's ever been in. You made that happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks down to his easy smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hate to think where you'd be without me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles back.       Tenderness we don't always see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll try to make you proud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did that long, long ago. Only ne person left to prove yourself o. Just make sure you do it.

dialogues.speaker: A
dialogues.text: beat.   The doubt comes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then the best part.    The future.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares in his eyes.       Leans to him. AMELIA (a whisper) Oh yeh.    That.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She brings her hands to his face. Her mouth to his. Longing. Her body sinks into him. LONG ANGLE.      Two alone.   Only each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 90 LONG ANGLE. From the open door of a hangar we see Amelia George facing reporters in front of the idling Electra. S sits on the wing, he's just beneath her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The radio problems crept up on us ver time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The marine 500 kilocycle radio was left in Oakland. Amelia said she

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GEORGE(cont'd) and Fred were both amateurs at Morse Code, so the radio wasn't worth what it weighed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amelia has made the boys laugh.    George laughs with the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The 250 foot trailing auxiliary antenna, she would leave behind in Miami. Too heavy, not important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASHES now. And plenty of them. She reaches down to take George's hand and HOPS down from the wing. More FLASHES..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, suddenly our remaining radio ouldn't reach its designated frequencies. Pan Am hurriedly replaced the main antennae. And we thought all was well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amelia and George coming toward us now, hand in hand, lea the press behind. Into... The hangar. In shadow here.     The world far away, she t his hands. A silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Race you to California. I'll go west. Five bucks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you'll fly the plane.   Make it twenty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simpkin keeps many mice at one time. Each under a different teacup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.   He's finally going to hear this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're saying he's cruel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Controlling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Insecure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah.   The light begins to dawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He needs the illusion of activity o feel comfortable. That he's preparing for all contingencies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George has to grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That he has more irons in the F ire than anyone knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Especially the mice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. Each poor mouse thinks it's all about her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Staring at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And one of them.    Is right. AMELIA (a murmur) She knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: want you to give me something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's never sounded quite like this before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me this is your last flight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes flicker.     Look down.   A whispered...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when the eyes come up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you know I couldn't? Even if part of me wanted to. Very, very much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The look holds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can we be anything. But what we are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no answer.    She leans up into a slow kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something in her serious face makes him smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I love you back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Takes a step back toward the hangar door. One hand slight up, stay here. Then, the smile he's waited for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles back. She turns and heads out toward the idling plane. She seems small, even fragile, alone on the tarmac STAY with George.    Watching her go.

dialogues.text: 92 Driving RAINSTORM as Amelia carries her gear toward the Electra. Fred waits. The umbrellas aren't keeping them dr

dialogues.speaker: SUPERIMPOSE
dialogues.text: The buildings have thatched roofs.    There are oxcarts b runway, abandoned to the downpour.    Fred has to shout o the storm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOU'RE NOT REALLY TAKING OFF!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IT'S GOING TO GET HEAVIER AND WE COULD BE STUCK HERE FOR DAYS. EVEN WEEKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just glares at her.   Rain POUNDING all around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ONLY 700 MILES TO BANGKOK, IT'S LIGHTER THERE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay if you like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she climbs into the plane.   He just stands in the ra and glowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Electra ROARING down the runway. It's all alone, no o else crazy enough to be out there. At last the plane... ...LIFTS INTO the rain.    Wobbles just a beat.    And be CLIMB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 94 A wrenching battle, plane versus monsoon. The storm is heavier, deafening, actually STRIPPING PAINT from the Electra's wings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amelia beyond exhaustion, but focused, fighting it. she's flying alone. Until... ...Fred drops into the seat beside her. No words as he watches her struggle. Our plane is all over the sky. The DIN is ungodly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOU THINK WE SHOULD TURN BACK, HUH?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NOPE.     I THINK WE SHOULDN'T HAVE COME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An AIR POCKET DROPS them 200 feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARD TO IMAGINE LANDING IN THIS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'VE GOT AN IDEA.     LET'S NEVER COME DOWN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She glances over.    For once, she's scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOW COULD YOU FIND OUR WAY BACK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SINCE I FORGOT TO DROP BREAD CRUMBS, WE'LL HAVE TO USE DEAD RECKONING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THAT'S IT?     JUST A GUESS?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: US NAVIGATORS PREFER THE TERM `WILD- ASS GUESS.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Held look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's more like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts to TURN the plane around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 96 Amelia flying down through heavy turbulence, though it is longer raining. Her features tense. We see the accumulate strain of the adventure.

dialogues.speaker: F
dialogues.text: red appears from the catwalk, slips into the seat beside her. He's worried. Points, and we see... ...CALCUTTA below, sprawling and endless. Between us and ground, a huge gathering of FLYING SHAPES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black eagles. If one of those clips a propeller. Or flies into the engine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her tired features form a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 've got an idea. Let's never land. Better safe than sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes her point.    She turns back to work...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll wake you when the coffee's ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with cold-blooded nerve, she SWOOPS down, down, THROU the flock of eagles, scattering them as we arc in for a perfect landing. She never turns to... ...Fred, who is still white-knuckling, trying to get his heart started. He can't believe what she's just done. Rolling, rolling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cream, no sugar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing shot of a graceful pillar of the Raj.   Nigh falling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 98 A fountain in an ornate courtyard. There is a RECEPTION, every evening for Amelia, attended by local DIGNITARIES. Fred, already a little drunk, leads Amelia to a massive t wood table. He breaks off the corner of a cracker, sets i down in the center of the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howland Island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He strikes a match. SNUFFS the flame. Puts the burned-out match head just by the scrap of cracker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: B lack smoke from the Navy ship that could help us get a fix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Points way across the marble courtyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now stand over there. That's what it's going to look like, if the weather's good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Earhart?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She glances up.   He beckons respectfully. NGLE. Alcove still with a VIEW of Fred and the courtyard. She lifts a telephone...

dialogues.text: 99 CLOSE on a WALL MAP. We realize that George has been fol- lowing her odyssey on a map of his own. We PULL BACK to reveal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Earhart? Mr. Earhart, here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks elegant in crisp suit and tie. INTERCUT: Amelia's eyes WIDE. She seems truly thrilled. INTERCUT BETWEEN THEM now throughout...

dialogues.text: R

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: S T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my goodness.   Simpkin, is it really you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George makes a PURRING sound.     A sharp MEOW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is insane. It's so extravagant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It gets worse, I bought a brand-new suit and tie. Got a date with my wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't possibly afford this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ure, we can. It's Tuesday's call o Lae that we can't afford. AMELIA (delighted) You hang up the phone this minute. You'll bankrupt us and I'll have to walk home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: easoning with me. A magnificent display of useless courage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes remember.    A soft...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..and it's fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOLD on her face.    And MATCH DISSOLVE TO...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 100 ...Amelia's FACE, as we left it in the first scene. The STORM PELTING all around the open-sided bar. Fred studyin her across the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A touching love story, really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's been drinking, we can hear it in his voice.   SEE th bottle now. Nearly gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An honest one. It's what you wanted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods.   That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder if it's honest enough for George. If it's what he wanted. ou know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you mean Gene, we're not together anymore. In that way. Not for a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whose choice was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't like his tone.      Shifts in her seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, isn't it always? You choose in, you choose out. Makes things easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything but easy. Are you disapproving of the way I live?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, no. It's just like me. In fact, it's like most guys I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I'd like a piece of it myself. Right about now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes harden.       A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you have a point, Fred.   Make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I believe I have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rises slowly. Zips her flight jacket.        Takes he from the back of her chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allow me to cut you a deal, my friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steel in the spine of that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You show up tomorrow morning. You show up sober and you get me to Howland Island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'll forget you ever said that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She WHEELS around and holding her slicker over her head, OFF into the POUNDING RAIN. Fred's smile is gone.     He stares after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 101 Amelia down the path in her slicker toward a small hut. knocks. Opens the door to reveal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 102 ...the radio receiver and transmitter.     The operator B is a wiry Scot. He nods respectfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready, Mum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands and she takes his seat. He shows her the key to press, then steps back toward the window. But she makes n move to the radio. Just stares at him. He doesn't understand. AMELIA (gently) Feel like stepping out for a smoke...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.   The monsoon beats down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you need help, I'll be right outside. In the rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.     I'll only be a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts on his slicker.   OPENS an umbrella.    Leaves. She looks back to the radio.   FLIPS the switch. E         AMELIA (soft) arhart here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 103 George at a window, looking west.     Over the Pacific. there somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should be sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles to keep his voice up. The eyes aren't smiling. INTERCUT their conversation throughout...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should be working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm running a big adventure here, 'm a very important fellow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told me I was the star.   And you were no one at all. GEORGE (soft) I thought I was lying. Guess the joke's on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's Fred?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm mad at him. I'll be in Honolulu on the 3rd, and with you in Oakland for Fourth of July. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't keep me waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't dare. You're a very important feline. Uh, fellow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk to me about Fred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred is fine. He's calculating head-wind speed versus fuel as we speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wouldn't sell a salesman would you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's that I hear in     your voice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he drinking? AMELIA (soft) I can handle it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call it off. Right now.      I mean it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can handle it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After the Fourth.     We're going home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For me?   Anywhere you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She begins to cry. Both hands fly to her mouth and she lo away. She swallows hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to like it there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd better. Since this is my last flight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well.    If you insist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods.   She does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: t's late here. Guess I'll go curl up under a teacup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go tell the world you're on your way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither wants to let go.      We feel it so strong. GEORGE (a whisper) Sweet dreams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat. AMELIA (whispers back) See ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he's gone.      She stares at the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 104 FLICKER of a kerosene lamp.      Amelia writing at a tiny Thinks now. Thinks. Lost in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 105 A sober, contrite Fred comes down the runway in early lig As he reaches the Electra, he sees a pile of discarded OBJECTS on the tarmac... ...metal containers, carton of oranges, parachutes. Bedrolls, cold weather gear. Souvenirs from their stops: flags, a metal plaque, native crafts, a Welcome Miss Amel Earhart banner. As he studies the pile... ...a COFFEE POT comes FLYING out of the plane to roll at feet. Suddenly, a 10 pound coffee tin SAILS PAST, as he DUCKS. Amelia appears at the hatch, sees him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're finding the range. But it might be easier to just shoot me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares at him for a moment.       A subdued voice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Traveling light, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits on the lip of the hatch.       Her legs dangling eyes down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got room for 190 pounds of asshole?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer.       She's still looking down.   He's never s like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a'am, I am so sor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes come up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't understand, but he's glad to be forgiven. She takes a LETTER from her pocket. Runs her finger over the envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can run into town before we go. et that in the post for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shakes her head slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's for my husband. I'm going to hand it to him. So I can watch his face as he reads it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sniffles slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's our tradition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 106 A RUNWAY that ends in a drop-off at the waters of Huon Gu The Electra, engines REVVING. Ready to go for it. Our ANG CLOSES on the belly of the plane. The ANTENNA MAST supporting a trailing WIRE ANTENNA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten A.M., Friday July 2. They lined up on the thousand-yard runway. One thousand gallons of fuel, enough for 20 to 21 hours of flying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LONG ANGLE. Crew and onlookers watch as the plane STARTS run, gathering speed, BOUNCING over uneven ground... CLOSE now on the jouncing undercarriage, a momentary PUFF DUST, and as the plane moves PAST, we may notice that the belly antenna mast seems to be GONE. DOWN the runway it RUMBLES, still earthbound, only 200 ya to go. Then 100. Then FIFTY, then at the water's edge, th Electra RISES and... . ..DROPS out of sight below the land, as we SMASH CUT to.. ANGLE. The Electra has FALLEN to SIX FEET above the surfa of the Gulf. The engines THROB at max, the propellers THROWING SPRAY. The overloaded plane... ...RISING.    Slowly, then faster, then... ...SOARING free. PULL BACK to a VIEW from down the runway. The Electra in distance. RACK FOCUS to see something long and slender GLINTING on the ground. Could it be a length of WIRE?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 107 Through the glass, the sun is disappearing toward Amelia. PULL BACK to George, staring at a CABLE in his hands. We HEAR...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Putnam. Their headwinds are stronger than they knew when they took off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I recalculated their fuel. It will cost them 9%.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George staring off. Assessing the consequences. PULL BACK to see an ENSIGN standing, waiting for instruction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't raise them, sir. I tried voice, and Morse Code...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: W

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George looks up.   Calmly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ire back. Tell him to forget the Morse Code. They didn't bring the receiver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The young man looks concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tell him to stay with voice. He'll get them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ERIAL ANGLE. A tiny, flat, nearly invisible speck adrift the endless Pacific. Howland Island. PAN to see just offshore...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The U.S. Coast Guard cutter Itasca had been anchored off Howland just for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on the ITASCA now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its radio would be her lifeline. Its black plume of smoke would reach for miles. More visible than the island itself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DISSOLVE TO NIGHT. The island visible only by its slender LIGHTHOUSE. The ship illuminated in the darkness. CLOSE now on a path by the sea. A lone figure with a FLASHLIGHT approaches a SHACK. Enters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 109 ...a room filled with radio equipment. He is FRANK CIPRIA in crisp naval uniform, relieving a SEAMAN who has been o duty. As Cipriani sits at his station, he notices...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The direction finder.   How long has this been on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The seaman turns back at the door.   What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 110 CLOSE on the ship, illuminated.   PUSH IN...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is 9 x 20 with bare walls. At the transmitter, L BELLARTS the chief radio man. Short and square, an unflappable air of quiet expertise. With him, his assista WILLIAM DALTEN, lean and young with dark serious eyes. At typewriter sits THOMAS O'HARE, barely twenty, headphones across his shock of rust-colored hair, telegraph at the ready.

dialogues.speaker: UPERIMPOSE
dialogues.text: Dalten adjusting the receiver which is suddenly spitting STATIC. Threading through the noise, what could be a huma voice. Bellarts calls to O'Hare...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's her on 3105. She said `cloudy and overcast.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O'Hare looks at him. Are you serious? Bellarts mimes typi with his fingers. O'Hare starts typing into the log. DISSOLVE TO... SUPERIMPOSE:    3:45 A.M. Radio CRACKLES.    All eyes turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Itasca from Earhart. Overcast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Static.   Dalten leans to the mic... DALTEN (into mic) We are receiving your signal. Please acknowledge ours. What is your position? When do you expect to arrive Howland?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer.    Light static.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commander estimated 7:00. If she's having trouble on voice transmission, stay with Morse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And begins to carefully pack his pipe.      Dalten begins transmit Morse Code. DISSOLVE TO... SUPERIMPOSE:    6:45 A.M. The radio.    The static.   The sudden voice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: K

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please take bearing on us and report in half hour. I will make noise in microphone. We are about 100 miles out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The transmission cuts out.     Dalten answers in Morse Co response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's got to stay on longer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bellarts dictating as O'Hare types...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earhart signal strength 4, but on A ir so briefly bearings impossible.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERIMPOSE
dialogues.text: DALTEN (to Bellarts) Maybe her Morse receiver is out. (into mic) Can't take bearing on 3105. Please send on 500 or do you want to take bearing on us? Go ahead, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.   O'Hare typing:    NO ANSWER. SUPERIMPOSE:    7:30 A.M. DALTEN (into mic) Please acknowledge our signals on ey. Please acknowledge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRACKLE.   O'Hare typing:    UNANSWERED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy, intercom top deck, double check the smoke stack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTERCUT: AERIAL ANGLE high above the ship.       BLACK S PLUMES into clear sky...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They should be able to see it for twenty miles, at least.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TILT ANGLE.    In far distance, thirty to forty miles, a STORM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few others enter now. Civilians, sailors, they hang bac silently, watching as... SUPERIMPOSE:   7:42 A.M.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KHAQQ calling Itasca. We must be on you but cannot see you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glances are traded. It is the first moment of visible concern. STATIC interrupts. Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gas is running low. Been unable to reach you by radio. We are flying t altitude 1000 feet. DALTEN (into mic) You are reaching us. We are sending on 3105 and 500 constantly. Please acknowledge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Massive BURST of static. Dalten frantically CLICKING a message in Morse Code. DISSOLVE TO...

dialogues.speaker: UPERIMPOSE
dialogues.text: The room has nearly filled. COMMANDER THOMPSON stands at Bellart's shoulder. All eyes fixed on the radio...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are circling but cannot hear you. Go ahead on 7500. BELLARTS (into mic) Itasca to KHAQQ. Your signal is strong. Are you receiving this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A breathless moment.   A sharp CRACKLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KHAQQ calling Itasca. We received your signal, but unable to get a minimum. Please take bearing on us and answer 3105 with voice. BELLARTS (into mic) Your signal received okay. It is impractical to take a bearing on 3105 on your voice. Give us a longer signal, please. Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.   Feet are shifting.   No one speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: O

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BELLARTS (softly to Dalten) Keep us at 7500, that's her only acknowledgment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got her signal, dammit. What about the direction finder?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cipriani reports the battery's dead, sir. It was left on all night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Full beat. THOMPSON (low) I don't believe this is happening.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERIMPOSE
dialogues.text: BELLARTS (into mic) Itasca to Earhart. Did you get transmission on 7500? Go ahead on 500 so that we can take a bearing on you, it's impossible on 3105. Please acknowledge.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERIMPOSE
dialogues.text: No breath in this room.      No one moves. BELLARTS (into mic) Will you please come in and answer n 500? We are transmitting constantly on 7500 and we do not hear you on 500. Please answer on 500. Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERIMPOSE
dialogues.text: Suddenly, a thin and anxious VOICE cuts through a burst o static...            A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are on the line of position 157- 337, will repeat this message on 6210 kilocycles. Wait, listening n 6210 kilocycles. We are running north and south.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: B

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: F

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BELLARTS (into mic) We hear you. We hear you. Can you receive this...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.   Silence.   Silence. COMMANDER (softly) Mr. Bellarts. When did she say she was low on fuel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All eyes shift to Tommy.    He scans the log.    Stares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um. An hour. And two minutes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOLD on this room.    DISSOLVE TO... AERIAL ANGLE. The ship in clear daylight.       The BLACK of smoke stretching to heaven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 113 The tiny room we've come to know. It is filled with peopl who stand motionless, staring somberly at one man. In tur he stares at a telephone... Which RINGS. Mary reaches, but his hand goes UP and she pulls back. He lets it ring three times, four, gathering himself. Lifting it... GEORGE (into phone) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are no other words.    His eyes tear up.    He nods at the phone.        G

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking back, the questions were obvious. Why would anyone try to ind such a tiny target in a vast ocean, with barely an hour's lee- way in fuel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He draws a breath. GEORGE (into phone) Well, we're most grateful. With such an effort, of course they'll e found.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on him now.   As he listens, as he responds graciou MOS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I tortured myself. Why hadn't killed this plan on day one? And then I realized...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 114 Alone.   In a moonlit garden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I tried to count the insane and reckless chances she took from the first moment I met her. I wouldn't know where to begin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly to his knees.   By the plants they had tended toge

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was the most tragic of endings. The most cruel and senseless and wasteful. And yet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's hard to imagine another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 115 Sun and cloud.   The sea below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Simpkin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We POINT toward the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to be married to you. The way you've been married to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It begins to draw CLOSER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you read this. I am watching your face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And CLOSER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am hoping to see. That you know how much I mean each word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gaining SPEED now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the things I never said, for so very long...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HURTLING TOWARD the surface...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look up. They're in my eyes.

dialogues.speaker: SMASH CUT TO BLACK.
dialogues.text: Hold.
